result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Sean Pierret was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all prison funds at a rate to be determined by DOC and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall not enter establishments where the primary purpose is the sale or service of alcohol.
Defendant shall not possess any alcohol in his home.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment and or school.
Defendant shall maintain a stable residence. 
Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Nadia Perez-Reyes for  State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Peter J. Cannon for State.  On motion of the state, Court amends complaint to reflect "while under the influence of an intoxicant", State to file an amended complaint w/in 48 hours.   Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court sets $1500 cash bond. Def does not qualify for SPD.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.   Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for April 16, 2014 at 09:45 am.
